In Bedrock Edition, the offhand is currently very limited compared to Java Edition. I believe it would greatly improve gameplay if Bedrock also had a proper offhand slot.

How it could work:

A new slot appears on the left side of the hotbar, just like in Java Edition.

Players can double-click items to swap them between the main hand and offhand.

The right hand remains the main hand. For example, if both hands hold blocks, only the right-hand block would be placed.

An extra control button could allow players to use both hands independently. This way, a player could swing a mace with one hand while throwing a wind charge with the other, or mine with a pickaxe in the right hand while placing blocks with the left hand.

Why this is important:

It would bring Bedrock Edition closer to Java Edition, making gameplay more consistent across platforms.

It adds more combat and building flexibility.

It gives players better control and creativity during fights, exploration, and building.

In Minecraft Java Edition, the off-hand feature is one of the most useful mechanics for both builders and fighters. Players can carry torches, blocks, food, fireworks, or even shields in their secondary hand, creating faster and smoother gameplay. Unfortunately, in Bedrock Edition, the off-hand is still extremely limited, which frustrates many players. Right now, the only items that really work are maps, arrows, totems of undying, and sometimes nautilus shells. That‚Äôs it. Imagine trying to explore caves on mobile or console while holding a sword in one hand and torches in the other‚Äîit‚Äôs simply not possible in Bedrock. Instead, players have to constantly open their hotbar or inventory, which slows down the entire flow of the game.

If Mojang added true off-hand support to Bedrock, the experience would become way more balanced with Java. Building would be easier, because you could keep blocks in your main hand and tools in your off-hand without endless swapping. Combat would also change massively: shields, food, and bows would work together, creating more depth for PvP. Even survival runs would feel smoother, since speedrunners could eat, place blocks, and fight all at once. Some people argue Mojang avoids this to keep controls simpler for touch and console players, but many fans think it‚Äôs time for Bedrock and Java to finally match. Adding full off-hand use would not only close the parity gap but also make Bedrock Edition feel like the complete Minecraft experience we want ü•≤

Subject: Suggestion for Off-Hand Items in Minecraft Bedrock Edition
Dear Mojang Team,
I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to share a suggestion that could greatly enhance the gameplay experience in the Bedrock Edition of Minecraft.
As you may know, the Java Edition allows players to use an off-hand for items like torches, which significantly improves quality of life. Unfortunately, the Bedrock Edition currently does not support this feature.
I believe that adding this functionality would enhance the Bedrock Edition in several ways:
Improved Building: Having torches in the off-hand makes it much easier to light up areas while building, reducing the need to constantly switch items.
Enhanced Exploration: When exploring caves, having a torch in the off-hand allows for seamless lighting and more efficient navigation.
Better Quality of Life: This small change would make a big difference in gameplay, bringing the Bedrock Edition closer in versatility to the Java Edition.
Many players have expressed their enthusiasm for this feature, and I believe it would enhance the overall experience.
Thank you for considering this suggestion. I look forward to seeing how Minecraft continues to evolve!
Best regards,
Koushal

I've tested this beta thoroughly, and here's some problems:

While pressing the joystick, my character often stops/attack/etc because my thumb creates multiple touches. Try to press the joystick forward with your entire thumb, and you can see this problem. If you disable "lock joystick" and move forward, sometimes the joystick itself will move due to the thumb causing multiple touches, forcing your character to stop (try it!).

The joystick has varying move-speed, and I'd like an option to disable it. This is especially a problem if you disable "lock joystick" option, you'll often move slowly. Pushing the joystick should immediately use the maximum speed in that direction.

On "joystick & tap to interact" mode, add an option to show action buttons. Try to catch fish in buckets without action buttons, it's near-impossible.

In the touch options menu, "button size" & "default settings" has glitches. There's building issues with scaffolding as you can't crouch while on it. Boat is missing action buttons.

Putting problems aside, I think this is going in the right direction. Autosprint option is a lifesaver and should be ON by default. We still need full customization: I want a big jump button on the top-left while disabling "lock joystick", using left thumb/index finger to move. I want to move pause/chat button, food/hunger & status effects to the center. And I want extra buttons to instantly use items without pressing/switching hotbar, it'll make mobile gameplay much better.

I highly suggest checking out the mobile touch controls of other games in the mobile store. Common games like Critical Ops have a better joystick; it doesn't freeze if you slide it forward with your big thumb, and there's lots of buttons and customization. You can drag each button anywhere, and you can resize it by pinching the selected button. Players can create 4-finger touch controls with ease, and the UI/controls feel so smooth. It felt like a premium, well-made game, and we should learn from them. In comparison, minecraft's touch controls are very difficult to work with. I cannot move properly, as the joystick kept freezing.

I've tested the "enable new touch controls" in the latest public release (1.19.31). It's not good, here's my experience:

I started with 100 button size setting. The joystick is on the left of my screen, but it's too large & too high for my thumb. My character is moving slowly, and I need to extend my thumb very far to move at maximum speed & allow sprint. The auto-sprint option is not automatic when moving forward, which sucks. The status effect icons are killing me, they are close to jump button and I'd often accidentally press the status icon when jumping, creating window popups that paralyze and kill my character. Statuses need to be placed on top of the screen.

Next, I reduce the button size as I prefer a small joystick. But now, the small joystick is on an awkward corner, on the bottom left of my screen. I cannot press the joystick & hold my phone at the same time, because my thumb & hand is shifted to the lower left. Now the jump/crouch button is too small to be pressed, and I prefer them to be at 100 button size. I'm failing jumps, leading to deaths.

Then, I revert the new touch options, and changed the button size back to 100. Unfortunately, the button size bug from the beta has not been fixed, even though it's been mentioned here. After sliding the bar to 100, I cannot properly scroll the options menu. Whenever I touch the screen the button size bar permanently follows my touch. Closing the options window will change button size as the bar follows my finger.

Continuing the above post, mobile controls are unfortunately still terrible. Auto-sprint should immediately auto-sprint when moving forward, without having to slide your thumb all the way up. The joystick shouldn't be on the center-left of the screen at 100 button size, and it shouldn't be at the extreme lower-left corner at 10 button size. By default, it should stay at a comfortable lower-left area, but NOT the extreme corner. The status icons need to be at the center-upper area of the screen, away from the hands so it's visible and will have no accidental touches. By default, the jump, crouch, and action buttons should stay on the lower-right for the right thumb to press. Right now they keep shifting up and down as the button size changes.

However, the game really needs full customization of HUD and buttons, as I personally want buttons on the upper corners for my pointer fingers, with varying sizes.

It's best to recruit game devs that are familiar with mobile touch controls, such as those working on PUBG and the like. Devs that have played mobile games extensively. I've tested minecraft's new controls using multiple phones, and they have glaring issues compared to other mobile games.

My idea is to improve the controls and some aspects on mobile devices and for that I propose this series of ideas:

Characteristics:
1.- Complete customization for the entire interface, by this I mean being able to move the hunger bar, health, the quick access bar, the pause button, emotes, chat, the coordinates, the number of days and in general everything that is shown in the interface.

2.- Also duplicating these means being able to have two buttons of the same type.

3.- Zones that divide the screen, for example the movement, attack and joystick zone.

3.- More buttons such as changing the camera.

4.- More quick accesses in the manufacturing interface. For example: when you press outside the interface of any work table (specifically at the top of the screen) it closes automatically without having to press the (X) button.
And to throw the items we could do it at the bottom of the screen.
In my opinion, this would give us greater speed to manufacture, trade, etc.

I want this to be done primarily for PVP and in general to improve how quickly we play Minecraft.
To play with 3 or 4 fingers without failures like what happens currently where the camera sometimes goes crazy.

If the developers or if more people read this suggestion, I invite you to leave your ideas on how to improve controls on mobile devices.
Thank you and I hope my suggestion is taken into account.

Eliminating any sort of bulk crafting ability has made playing on mobile nearly unbearable. I craft most things by the stack. In a more extreme example, turning a chest full of bones into bone blocks takes 16 minutes of long holding the item output slot, plus handling time. We need some way to craft an entire stack of items in under 5 seconds, 16 seconds is too much given the volume of crafting many of us do.
Please please please provide us a way to bulk craft. Doesn‚Äôt have to be full stack, but it is unbearably slow now.
Please bring back the long-press to craft a stack or make it MUCH faster for a long-press. Crafting a stack of anything is TOO slow now!
I think we should AT LEAST have a setting where we can adjust how fast the long press crafts a single item, like maybe there could be a slider to adjust the amount of time it takes.

A simple fix could be to add a second button to the crafting output GUI that would function in the same way as the Shift key on a keyboard. One could then press only the original crafting output button to craft slowly at the current rate, or press both output buttons to craft everything in the grid almost instantly (ie the previous long press rate of crafting).

 

Edit: also if anyone is looking for a temporary fix, you can get a Bluetooth keyboard and connect it to your phone/tablet, then click on item you want to craft, press Shift on keyboard and tap on crafting output on the touch screen at the same time. Your items will then be crafted at the previous rate (almost instantly).
